attributes.action: Rent cap on properties owned by the Duchies of Lancaster and Cornwall
attributes.additional_details:
Public bodies and other nonprofit organisations face significant financial challenges as they work to serve vulnerable communities.

Currently, some of them are paying high rents for properties managed by either the Duchy of Lancaster or the Duchy of Cornwall. These costs divert essential resources away from their core missions.

By reducing financial pressures on these services, the royal family can make a meaningful contribution to the wellbeing of the public they ostensibly serve.
attributes.background:
We call on the Duchies of Lancaster and Cornwall to introduce a cap of £10 per year in rent on properties leased to charities, public bodies, and community services.

The recent Channel 4 Dispatches revealed that, while the duchies do not pay taxes, they receive funds from taxpayer-funded sources.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign the following petition, which calls for similar action:

Review of the Royal Duchies, Crown estate and sovereign grant
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/700719
